skill.name: playwright-best-practices
skill.description: Provides Playwright test patterns for resilient locators, Page Object Models, fixtures, web-first assertions, and network mocking. Must use when writing or modifying Playwright tests (.spec.ts, .test.ts files with @playwright/test imports).
skill.summary: Provides Playwright test patterns for resilient locators, Page Object Models, fixtures, web-first as...
skill.author: 0xBigBoss

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only markdown content with code examples. No executable code, no file system access, no network calls, no command execution. Behavior exactly matches stated purpose.

content.value_statement: Playwright tests often become brittle and flaky over time. This skill provides battle-tested patterns for locators, assertions, fixtures, and page objects that create maintainable, self-healing tests.
actual_capabilities: Provides locator priority guide from accessibility roles to CSS/XPath as last resort
Documents Page Object Model patterns with encapsulation and reusable helpers
Covers fixtures including worker-scoped and automatic fixtures
Explains web-first assertions with auto-wait and retry behavior
Details network mocking with route patterns and HAR file usage
Shows authentication setup with storageState for test isolation
limitations: Does not execute tests or interact with browser directly
Does not install or configure Playwright dependencies
Does not generate test code automatically from page interaction
Focused on test authoring patterns, not CI/CD pipeline setup

use_cases.title: Create maintainable test suites
use_cases.description: Build test suites that survive UI changes by using role-based locators and proper page object patterns.

use_cases.title: Write reliable component tests
use_cases.description: Verify component behavior with proper test isolation, fixtures, and assertion patterns.

use_cases.title: Set up testing infrastructure
use_cases.description: Configure Playwright projects, reporters, and CI integration for team-wide testing.

prompt_templates.title: Basic test setup
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me set up Playwright tests for my web app with proper configuration, project structure, and a login page object model.

prompt_templates.title: Fix flaky locators
prompt_templates.prompt: My Playwright tests are failing because selectors are brittle. Show me how to use getByRole, getByLabel, and other resilient locators instead of CSS classes.

prompt_templates.title: Mock API responses
prompt_templates.prompt: I need to mock API responses in my Playwright tests to test error states and edge cases without a backend. Show me the route patterns.

prompt_templates.title: Optimize CI runs
prompt_templates.prompt: My Playwright test runs are too slow and verbose in CI. Help me configure parallel execution, minimal reporters, and proper test isolation.

output_examples.input: Help me write a Playwright test for user login with proper patterns
output: Use getByRole and getByLabel for resilient form locators
Wrap actions in safe helpers with visibility and enabled checks
Store auth state in setup project to avoid UI login per test
Create LoginPage class extending BasePage with page object pattern

best_practices: Use user-facing locators (getByRole, getByLabel) before CSS/XPath to survive UI refactoring
Prefer fixtures over beforeEach for reusable setup with automatic cleanup
Configure minimal reporters (line/dot) in CI and agent contexts to prevent context overflow
anti_patterns: Using page.waitForTimeout() instead of auto-waiting locators with assertions
Writing CSS or XPath selectors when role/label/testid alternatives exist
Logging in via UI in every test instead of reusing storageState from setup

faq.question: Which Playwright version does this skill support?
faq.answer: Patterns work with Playwright 1.40+ including getByRole locators, web-first assertions, and new fixture APIs.

faq.question: Can I use these patterns with Jest or Vitest?
faq.answer: Yes. Replace @playwright/test test() with jest-playwright or use @playwright/test as a standalone runner.

faq.question: How do I handle authentication in tests?
faq.answer: Create a setup project that logs in once and saves storageState. Other projects depend on setup and reuse auth state.

faq.question: What reporter should I use in CI?
faq.answer: Use line or dot reporter to prevent verbose output from consuming context. Configure in playwright.config.ts with CI env var.

faq.question: How do I test API endpoints?
faq.answer: Use the request fixture for API testing. Create and clean up test data per test for isolation. Never share state between tests.

faq.question: How do I debug failing tests?
faq.answer: Run with --trace on to capture screenshots and network logs. Use --debug for step-through or --ui for interactive mode.
